_comment: This is the Single Source of Truth for the Pelican AI project. It contains the complete project context, from high-level vision to the currently active execution phase. Use this file to maintain focus and ensure all work aligns with strategic goals.

project_identity.name: Pelican AI
project_identity.mission: To empower Louisiana educators with practical, ethical, and platform-agnostic AI guidance that reclaims their time for high-impact teaching.

strategic_context.problem_statement: [Describe the core problem for Louisiana educators: Overwhelm, time scarcity, ethical concerns, lack of localized guidance.]

target_audience.primary: K-12 Louisiana Educators (Eager Innovators, Cautious Optimists, Overwhelmed Veterans)

core_value_proposition: Platform-Agnostic Guidance: Works with ANY AI tool.
Louisiana-Aligned: Built for state standards and educator rubrics.
Ethical Guardrails: Responsible AI use is built-in.
Time-Saving: Immediate, practical solutions for common tasks.
strategic_context.competitive_differentiation: [What makes Pelican AI unique? e.g., Not another tool to learn, educator-led, Louisiana-first focus, guidance over software.]

product_vision._comment: This is the long-term vision. A 'parking lot' for all features. The current execution plan will only pull a small subset from this vision.

epics.name: Core Guidance Delivery
epics.description: Mechanisms for delivering expert-vetted AI frameworks to educators.
features: Categorization and filtering (by subject, standard, task)
User ratings and feedback on frameworks

epics.name: Community & Collaboration
epics.description: Features that enable educators to learn from and share with each other.
features: Innovation Sharing: Educators submit their own successful prompts/workflows.
Leaderboards or recognition for top contributors

epics.name: Personalization & Analytics
epics.description: Tools for educators to track their progress and personalize their experience.

epics.name: Administration & Moderation
epics.description: Tools for managing the platform, content, and users.

execution_plan._comment: This section defines the current, actionable work. Only one phase is 'active' at a time. This is the key to managing scope.

phases.name: MVP Validation: The 'Aha!' Moment Funnel
phases.goal: Validate that an email-first approach can successfully onboard an educator and deliver immediate, tangible value with a single AI prompt.
phases.hypothesis: A seamless email-based onboarding followed by a high-value weekly prompt will achieve high engagement and prove the core concept without needing a full web application.

in_scope: Database schema for users and beta signups

user_stories.story: As a busy teacher, I want to receive an invitation and easily sign up, so I can start receiving expert AI tips without learning a new platform.
acceptance_criteria: Successfully creates an account via a simple web form.

user_stories.story: As a new member, I want to automatically receive a weekly, practical AI prompt, so that I can immediately apply it and save time.
acceptance_criteria: Receives WeeklyPromptEmail on a recurring basis.
Email contains a clear, copy-paste ready prompt.

phases.exit_criteria: [Define what success looks like for this phase. e.g., 20+ educators successfully onboarded, 75%+ weekly email open rate over 4 weeks.]

phases.name: Phase 2: The First Web Experience
phases.goal: [e.g., Build a simple, read-only framework library on the web to give users a 'home base'.]

tech_stack.frontend: React 19, TypeScript, Vite, Tailwind CSS, shadcn/ui

architecture_principles: ADRs located in 'docs/decisions/' for key architectural choices.

solo_founder_workflow._comment: A personal protocol for using this document to stay focused.
focus_ritual: 1. Before starting work, review the 'goal' and 'scope_boundaries' of the 'Active' phase in 'execution_plan'.
2. Identify the next task. Does it directly serve one of the 'user_stories' for the active phase?
4. If NO: Is it a new idea? Add it to the appropriate 'features' list under 'product_vision' for a future phase. Then, go back to step 2.
5. At the end of the week, review progress against the 'acceptance_criteria' of the active user stories.
